results.title: Environment Artist
results.description:
Something Wicked Games is a new studio founded by creative and leadership talent behind some of the world's best role-playing games including Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, and The Outer Worlds. We create moving, impactful games in a collaborative, creatively autonomous environment.

Something Wicked Games is currently developing Wyrdsong, a preternatural RPG set in a semi-historical Middle Ages Portugal. We are a full remote studio looking for team members who are adventurous, confident, and purposeful.

Environment Artist

We are looking for an Environment Artist to help us create a landscape which evokes both a Western European Middle Ages look and dark, otherworld aesthetics. An ideal candidate has a portfolio which represents successful efforts.

Responsibilities

  • Engage with the art team to create and deliver environment models and textures
  • Contribute as part of a collaborative effort to create a unique game experience
  • Implement the necessary aesthetic throughout all art deliverables

Minimum Qualifications

  • Must have shipped a AAA video game, or have 3+ years of full-time experience at a AAA video game studio in a related Art role
  • Successful history of incorporating feedback within an iterative process
  • Ability to transform abstract ideas into delivered assets
  • Excellent texturing skills
  • Portfolio demonstrating relevant art styles
  • Must be proficient in at least one major DCC package (3dsmax or Maya preferred)

  • Zbrush

Strongly Preferred Skills

  • Houdini
  • UE
  • Photogrammetry (not software specific)

Pluses

  • Marvelous Designer
  • Experience with Unreal 5
  • Knowledge of latest texturing strategies
  • Engagement and enjoyment of role-playing games

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
About Covidence

At Covidence our mission is to dramatically improve lives by changing the way the world creates and uses knowledge. 

Launched in 2014 Covidence is a not-for-profit world leading SAAS platform that enables health and science research teams to rapidly synthesize and uncover actionable insights from the mountains of existing research in the world. 

Covidence is trusted by 170,000+ researchers and 200+ top institutions including the World Health Organisation, Harvard, Yale and Stanford. We have ambitious plans to scale and expand our feature set so we are looking for the right people to come on this exciting journey with us.  

Find out more about Covidence by visiting: www.covidence.org

 

The opportunity

Covidence is seeking a Senior Product Designer to join our 100% Remote Product & Engineering team.

We build and nurture a web-based tool that streamlines the production of systematic reviews. In case you didn't know, systematic reviews are considered the 'gold standard' for synthesizing evidence in health and other sciences because of their rigorous methodology.

We are seeking a designer that is excited by our mission and is motivated to help design and curate this incredibly valuable and complex product.

Reporting to our Chief Product & Technology Officer you will be the second product designer to join our team.

 

You'll get to:

  • Immerse yourself in our users world to become a go-to expert on systematic reviews 
  • Collaborate and workshop ideas with SMEs, Product Managers, Designers and Engineers to shape our product's experience
  • Design intuitive interfaces that tens of thousands of researchers rely on everyday
  • Hone your craft through UX best practices like prototyping, iterative design, user research
  • Define and drive customer research activities 
  • Work with the engineering team to define and deliver a design system 
  • Be part of a small tight-knit, high-achieving team that values trust and respect for one another
  • Work with great tools - Macbook Pro, Slack, Zoom, GSuite, Miro, Confluence, Figma, Axure

 

What you bring

  • Ability to design intuitive solutions for complex problems
  • Willingness to be a design all rounder i.e. you enjoy pitching in whatever design skills you have to get the best outcomes for our product
  • Strong command of user-centered design and research methods
  • A great collaborator with engineers and product managers
  • Great communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Experience working in an agile development environment
  • Strong interest in pioneering design systems

 

The perks and benefits

We offer:

  • competitive salaries relevant to your experience level
  • monthly home office allowance
  • remote team so you can live and work anywhere as long as you can offer a 4 hour workday crossover with the AEST timezone
  • work week flexibility - FT, PT or explore a flexible arrangement with us that best suits you
  • 4 weeks paid leave, an extra paid week off between Christmas and New Years and the option to purchase 3 more weeks pro rata
  • access to wellbeing services & programs
  • a knowledge allowance so you keep learning and developing

When you join Covidence you are joining a team that cares deeply for what we can build and achieve together. If you are ready to be more than just a cog in the machine; if you are smart, curious, want to create change, and are not scared of getting your hands dirty to make it happen – then this is the place for you.

 

How do I apply?

If you are interested in this opportunity, please hit APPLY and send us through your details. We'll be back in touch with you promptly. 

Should we proceed further you can expect 4 rounds of interviews:

  • Round 1: 30 min Zoom interview for us to get to know each other 
  • Round 2: 90 min Zoom interview diving into your design skills and experience 
  • Round 3: 90 min Zoom interview where you'll present a response to a case study scenario 
  • Round 4: 60 min interview with CEO 

In a hurry? We can speed this process up if needed - just let us know!

results.title: Product & Graphic Designer
results.description:
With the support of Vacuumlabs we have been working on a new FinTech product called Moneyhoon - a digital financial specialist with AI/ML components that will replace outdated financial advisors as we know them.
Moneyhoon brings clarity to abstract terms such as money, savings, investments, or insurance. You can be there not only to witness the creation of a revolutionary product but also to participate in making it real.

So that each and every one of us can manage our finances easily and independently, yet constantly having access to real experts. Imagine you have a trustworthy partner that provides understandable answers to questions like “Inflation is here. I have some cash. What should I do?”
Our vision is to bring peace of mind through better organizing our finances. We´re first and foremost building a product we need ourselves.
Our recruitment process is in place to ensure you can work with the most efficient and high-quality team.

 

We are looking for a Product & Graphic Designer for our project as part of the Moneyhoon team.
As a designer, you should be a problem solver who crafts practical and beautiful user experiences. Together with the team, you’ll help break down business and customer problems, imagine new and elegant solutions, and help bring great experiences to life.
Creating and editing graphic designs? It is a piece of cake for you.

 

What you’ll do

  • Contribute to our project Moneyhoon by making product improvements, as well as working on new product features from scratch.

  • Explore and communicate design concepts through sketches, user flows, low fidelity wireframes and prototypes.

  • Participate in design research, user research, and validation testing.

  • Communicate with team members throughout the process to ensure the designs fit the business goals and technical constraints.

  • Work closely with engineers to bring designs to life.

  • Advocate for best practices across the team.

  • Contribute to improving the end-to-end product delivery process, as well as our internal processes.

  • Create and edit graphic designs - visuals, banners, websites, flyers, newsletters, brochures, social media formats, and more types of different media.

     

What you'll need

  • A deep knowledge of mobile and web app design patterns and UX best practices.

  • An appreciation for the entire product development process - from idea generation and research to detailed UI/UX design.

  • Willingness to make decisions and take ownership of your work.

  • Experience with Figma and Adobe graphic tools.

  • Bonus skills such as UX writing and basic motion design are very appreciated.

     

What we offer

  • Work from Home and flexible hours.

  • Performance and compensation evaluations.

  • Unlimited sick days.

  • Paid days for professional growth.

  • Community and team-building activities.

 

Practicals

Location: Bratislava, Slovakia (but we also support remote cooperation from any location within Slovak or Czech Republic)
Starting Date: ASAP
Compensation: 2.500-3.500€/monthly based on your experience and seniority

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
About TrustedHousesitters

TrustedHousesitters is a global marketplace that is disrupting the pet care and travel industries. We connect a community of home and pet owners with sitters to solve a common two-sided problem - pet care and cost-effective travel. Customers join for one annual fee. After that, sits take place as a trust-based, money-free exchange that sees owners enjoy worry-free travel while our sitters enjoy the company of pets and unlock a world of unique accommodation.

We're fully in scale-up mode and have grown to be the only global platform of its kind. In the last few years, we’ve consistently achieved high year-on-year growth, and have remained resilient throughout the COVID-19 crisis. Thanks to strong tailwinds in the pet and travel industry in the post-Covid world, 2022 has been our strongest year so far. We closed a $10m series A funding round in 2021, and have an ambitious growth strategy to execute going forward.

We've recently made the transition to a remote-first business, however we've retained a HQ in central Brighton which is available for collaborative working and in-person meetups.

Requirements

We’re looking for a talented Senior Product Designer to join our Product team. This is a great opportunity to help scale TrustedHousesitters.

Ideal Start Date: January 2023

This is a remote UK-based role. Sorry, but we can't employ non UK-based candidates and sponsor visas at the moment.

What you’ll do at TrustedHousesitters

  • You will be working on member success and experience initiatives
  • As a Senior Product Designer for our Member Success team squad, you’ll work with developers, PM, data analyst and other stakeholders to help shape and contribute towards the product vision and roadmap for your area of product
  • Help uncover user problems through qualitative and quantitative research
  • Find solutions through ideation and creation of prototypes and testing
  • Partner with other designers, product and engineering to oversee and ensure quality user experience from conception to launch and continuous product iterations
  • Nurture best practices, investing in design standards, systems, and processes

 

Our ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience in :

  • Product design; leading projects from conception through to completion and successfully identifying and solving user problems
  • Strong UX focus, with ability to balance business and user needs
  • Designing for web and mobile apps (iOS and Android)
  • Interaction and visual design, prototyping, and testing
  • Conducting qualitative and quantitative research including user interviews
  • Interpreting data to inform design decisions
  • Experimentation and A/B testing
  • Writing or briefing product copy
  • Working within and contributing to design systems
  • Planning and running ideation sessions with cross functional team members
  • Putting user experience at the heart of the decision-making process and championing user led design within an organisation
  • Adapting designs across platforms with an understanding of their limitations and opportunities

Our ideal candidate will also have

  • A strong portfolio showcasing your work
  • 3+ years of experience designing products and solving user problems

We would love it if you could also demonstrate

  • Startup experience
  • Marketplace experience
  • Growth experience

 

Salary £60k-£70k per annum dependent on experience

Benefits

  • Fully remote work
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • 25 days holiday annually
  • Pension scheme: 5% from you as an employee and 3% from TrustedHousesitters
  • Premium TrustedHousesitters pet owner and sitter membership which includes benefits like airport lounge passes, sit cancellation insurance, and home and contents insurance for sits
  • Our team have an unlimited housesitting allowance, can work remotely from their sits, and TrustedHousesitters will contribute up to £500 per year towards travel costs
  • Monthly working from home stipend
  • Find a rescue pet to join your family and we’ll cover the adoption fees, as well as pawternity to help any pet settle into their new home.
  • We host a quarterly all expenses paid meetup, and will fund team events (remote or in person) throughout the year
  • We can cover costs of personal development resources, and have regular time set aside for personal development
  • Health Insurance plan
  • Brighton Bikeshare
  • Recruitment Referral Bonus
  • Access to Spaces Locations across the globe

results.title: Senior UX Designer
results.description:
About Us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development. 

The Qualio team is an all-remote, globally distributed workforce with teammates in over ten countries.

What’s the opportunity?

We are looking for a Senior UX Designer who will be joining our growing Product team. Together with product managers and engineers you will shape the user experience of Qualio and make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market. You will focus on  specific product areas and you will own all design-related aspects: from concept all the way to production design. You will also have an opportunity to improve the experience working on features that span the entire product. You will be able to use qualitative and quantitative data to drive your design decisions and validate your ideas with customers. We are looking for someone who enjoys a start-up environment where there are plenty of opportunities to bring their experience, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit - and have a critical impact on the user experience. 

What will I be doing?
  • Design simple, elegant, user-centric experiences that delight users and achieve their goals.
  • Define the Qualio user experience, interactions, and user interface through user flows, information architecture and visual design.
  • Test and validate design decisions against internal stakeholders and customers with mockups / prototypes throughout the design process.
  • Influence how we work by helping establish best design practices/operations
  • Ensure the quality and delivery of the user experience of the product  in collaboration with engineering.
What skills do I need?
  • 3-5 years of experience as a UX/UI/Interaction Designer role building B2B products from concept to completion managers and engineers to deliver solutions that solve the customer problem
  • Passion for the OOUX framework (also known as conceptual modeling or conceptual design), or a focus on early-stage UX work 
  • Has led large complex initiatives within organizations that involve multiple stakeholders and teams
  • Strong storyteller who can develop concepts to delight customers and deliver business results
  • A compelling portfolio of work that demonstrates high-quality design work and deep design thinking
  • Skilled ‘visual’ designer who can help shape and add to the developing product design style.
  • Highly skilled in Figma (design systems, prototyping)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills (in English)

Bonus requirements:

  • Experience in the Life Sciences industry.
  • Experience developing design systems and component libraries
  • Comfortable sharing your work via video recordings with any size audience.
  • Outside the box thinking that questions the future of the product vision.
Benefits 
  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Dependent & Health FSA, Short/Long Term Disability, Basic & Voluntary Life Insurance
  • Unlimited PTO policy
  • Company allowance for home office supplies
  • 12 weeks paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products get to market
A note to candidates:

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described.

 

##Qualio_NA #Qualio_ET #Qualio_CT #LI-Remote

results.title: Art Production Manager
results.description:
At Lockwood, our vision is to bring people together through Avakin Life so they can play, share and socialise! Listed as one of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies by the FT our journey’s only just begun. With great benefits including an employee share scheme and profit related quarterly bonus we’re always looking for talented individuals to join team. This is a great opportunity to be at the forefront of an exciting new direction for Lockwood, driving the growth of our products as well as being a driving force for improving processes and delivery framework.

The Art Production Manager is crucial to facilitating the creation of high-quality content for our product, Avakin Life. You will be an experienced production manager in art production, reporting into the Head of Content Production. Working closely alongside the Head of Content Production, Associate Art Director, Creative Director, and the Central Production Team, you will understand the processes and pipeline for art production of internal and external with outsourcing partners, define dependencies, issues and blockers, and implement the mitigation plans to resolve those. You will bring structure to our creative teams while collaborating with the project leadership and other disciplines to maintain communication in all directions.

We trust our Art Production Manager to ensure that assets are delivered on time; with quality, within budget and adhere to established pipelines. You are proactive in monitoring the content creation process from concept to build and beyond, working to mitigate production issues should they arise.

This role can be based out of any of our Lockwood offices (Cambridge, Lisbon, Nottingham, Newcastle, Vilnius) or fully remote with the option of office work at your discretion.

Responsibilities

 

  • POC for content production
  • Work closely with the Head of Content production to implement strategic initiatives, product and department goals
  • Quarterly ideation and planning with the art teams and producers
  • Planning and delivery of art assets requirements for product features
  • Support the art teams with planning, tracking and delivery of high volume and quality art asset releases
  • Anticipate and address potential problems like resource blockers, quality concerns, schedule and scope changes.
  • Support the team to maintain and deliver art direction and requirements set by Associate Art director and Content Directors
  • Work with content producers to align delivery of art and in game experiences for our players
  • Support content leads with artist assignment & sign off process
  • Support Content publishing team in case of issues with art assets or asset pipeline process.
  • Risk and (cross team) dependency management
  • Close collaboration and support of publishing team and QA to meet release deadlines
  • Forecasting and planning of Outsource requirements
  • Coordinate assignments, asset delivery, feedback and bug fixing
  • Support creation of outsource material and briefs
  • Work with OS partner to continuously improve quality of asset delivery
  • Ensure art pipeline and teams are setup efficiently
  • Improving pipelines, methods and the appropriate use of skills within the team to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Art Production
  • Identify and communicate art tool requirements and support planning, review and testing of art tools
  • Support art review and sign off process

 

Requirements

  • Significant art management experience working in a multi-national game production environment
  • In depth knowledge of 3D character and environment pipeline and processes
  • Planning high volume art asset and releases
  • Outsource management experience
  • Attention to details whilst not losing sight of the big picture
  • Agile mindset and ability to quickly adapt to changes
  • Change management experience
  • Agile practices
  • excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Familiar with several project management and bug tracking software (e.g. Jira)

 

Desirables

 

  • Metaverse experience
  • Live Ops experience
  • Background as a 3D artist
  • Line management experience

results.title: Senior Technical Artist
results.description:
At Lockwood, our vision is to bring people together through Avakin Life so they can play, share and socialise! Listed as one of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies by the FT for 2020 as well as winning numerous TIGA and other awards several years in a row, our journey’s only just begun. With great benefits including an employee share scheme and profit related quarterly bonus, we’re a great destination for those who want to work on cutting edge social experiences in an environment that fosters communication and creativity. We’re always looking for good people – so if you’re a great person and an amazing developer we’d love to hear from you.

We are looking for an awesome senior technical artist who has a solid background within mobile app/game development and experience of art pipelines, workflows and build processes. The role will involve working with our content, build and engineering teams, and maintaining/improving/reimagining our existing processes, pipelines and tooling.

This role can be based out of any of our Lockwood offices (Cambridge, Lisbon, Nottingham, Newcastle, Vilnius) or fully remote with the option of office work at your discretion.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with various teams throughout Lockwood to support existing processes and plan out improvements as needed.
  • Promote and adhere to best-practice with regards to art workflows; and continuously work to minimise technical and maintenance issues.
  • Collaborate with Leads and the Product team to help plan and schedule tasks with product releases;
  • Identify risks and provide relevant solutions in existing and new features / functionality.
  • Work alongside content teams to refine existing, and develop new pipelines and tooling for effective creation of content
  • Provide expert insight with our QA teams to identify and fix content issues in a timely manner;



Requirements

  • Significant technical art experience developing games, mobile applications or similar products.
  • Experience of shipping at least one game or mobile application
  • Excellent communication skills; you must be comfortable collaborating with colleagues from both programming and non-programming disciplines
  • Experience in working with art pipelines: environment, character, animations.
  • Experience with shaders across mobile and desktop platforms.
  • Knowledge of build/CI and maintaining/implementing art pipelines
  • Eliciting requirements from non-technical stakeholders e.g. content, product owners.
  • Desirables: Unity3D, C#, C++, Python/MayaScript, Experience working on a live product, Experience with Jenkins, and Git/Perforce/SVN, Great communication skills, friendly, open minded, positive, self-motivated and proactive.

results.title: Senior Environment Artist
results.description:
Perfect Storm Studios was founded by Game Industry Veterans to build the next generation of games. We believe that the best games will be those that can seamlessly integrate amazing game design, player rewards, and joint development with our player community. We are a fully remote company which actively puts the employees and community first. Perfect Storm Studios has an A+ excellent culture that is the perfect balance of both fun interactions and fulfilling work. Head on over to our website to learn more about our project!


The Role:

Perfect Storm Studios is looking for a Senior Environment Artist to support the creative and artistic development of our game. As a Senior Environment Artist, you will be responsible for modeling and texturing stylized 3D Environment Assets as well as helping to set, decorate and build out exciting locations.

Key Responsibilities:

- Have a good eye for lighting and establishing mood for a game world
- Conduct research for subjects and trends to support design solutions
- Work with the Central Art Team to produce a wide range of in game content of 3D assets and materials to create a unique look and feel to the game world
- Work in an iterative manner taking assets from blockouts to final game quality
- Work with Creative Directors to ensure all assets match art direction and style
- Ensure all assets are produced to benchmark quality
- Model high and low poly objects, bake textures, export/import assets, apply and create materials, assemble environments

Requirements

  • Comprehensive knowledge of industry standard 3D Software
  • Knowledge of industry standard pipelines and workflows, asset exporting process and implementation within the game.
  • Experience working with Unity and Lighting 3D Environments|
  • Keen understanding of current and new world building techniques and technologies and a desire to push quality while maintaining technical performance
  • At least 3-5+ years of experience as an Environment Artist

Application Requirements:

  • Portfolio demonstrating relevant artistic skills and past work
  • An art test may be required

Benefits

  • Flexible PTO
  • Competitive Compensation (Location Dependent)
  • Full Remote and Location Independence

Type of Position: Full-time
Location: REMOTE
Synchronous Core Hours: 9AM - 2PM PST

results.title: Product Designer, Analytics
results.description:
Company Description

We believe that now is the time to reevaluate the impact of spaces we create to live, work, and play. Building sustainably at a global scale requires better tools and technology for the people involved. We're attacking this at the core -- Outer Labs provides modern human-centric apps for stakeholders who can directly influence the way real estate, architecture, and construction decisions are made in their projects.

Some questions we find ourselves asking: ​How can we help an Architect explore thousands of ideas in the time it currently takes to explore one? How can software optimize the quality of space for usability while reducing the cost and resources required to build?​ How do we encourage adoption of reusable solutions that can be manufactured more sustainably and efficiently?

Answers to these questions require deep expertise in design and engineering that comes from every level of our company. This is why we’ve invested deeply in building a culture that empowers its employees to do great work and directly shape the future of its products. We want smart, creative, and intentional individuals to be part of our core team. Are you in?



Job Description

As a Product Designer for Analytics, you’ll work on a wide variety of challenging problems across a portfolio of clients and internal R+D efforts. Your core focus will be creating analytical tools that real estate owner teams are using for strategic planning and forecasting.

You’ll work directly with our clients who own and operate large occupant-focused real estate portfolios. You’ll leverage the insight of our product managers and strategists to build a point of view for the user, then bring your designs to life with our world-class engineering team using the latest and greatest technology. As part of a growing team, you’ll also get to shape the design culture at Outer Labs and directly influence the process of design and innovation.

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with Product Strategists to gather design research and market analysis for use in addressing stakeholder perspectives
  • Partner with Product Management, Product Strategy, and Engineering project team members to develop a user-centric point of view for the product.
  • Express design intent with high-quality mockups and clickable prototypes that embody the end-to-end user journey.
  • Leverage the full range of design expertise at Outer Labs by working closely with other designers to sharpen your intuition and iterate through your designs.
  • Facilitate the handoff of design requirements, clickable prototypes, and assets to developers by working closely with Product Managers and Engineering lead.
  • Advocate for user experience, field questions, and make adjustments as you work throughout the implementation phase.
  • Ensure the final result provides the intended value to stakeholders by responding to feedback and making adjustments as needed.


Qualifications
  • Relevant experience and portfolio working as a Product Designer, User Experience (UX) Designer, or similar role
  • Deep knowledge of user experience research and market analysis frameworks
  • Experience building and iterating on user journeys from design research
  • Experience wireframing, designing and prototyping in Figma, or similar application
  • Excellent eye for aesthetic design and latest design trends
  • Understanding of UX patterns and ability to work with Design Systems
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Driven by curiosity with exceptional attention to detail
  • Preference for fast-paced iteration, deadlines, and budgets
  • Experience with AEC industry is preferred


Additional Information

Benefits

  • Healthcare, dental, and vision insurance for employee & dependents.  We cover 85% of the cost for employee, and 75% of the cost for dependents

  • 401K with matching up to 4% of your salary

  • Paid parental leave for all new parents

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 11 paid company holidays

  • Computer and home office setup with phone and internet paid for up to $100 each.

  • Annual stipend for education and professional development

  • 100% remote working

 

Outer Labs provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
Senior Product Designer

The client is focused on providing solutions for managing the future of development work, today. This project is the first platform to manage global software development services in highly performant, agile, and autonomous teams. This platform empowers distributed development teams with people and teaming-centric tools to efficiently provide highly scalable services.

About the task

● Create design concepts and drawings to determine the best product.

● Present product ideas to relevant team members for brainstorming.

● Suggest improvements to design and performance to product engineers.

● Employ design concepts into functional prototypes.

● Perform research on product technologies and structures to implement into design

concepts.

● Maintain up to date on current industry trends and market conditions.

● Coordinate with designers to ensure accurate communication and efficiency in the

design phase.

● Modify and revise existing designs to meet customer expectations.

● Create and maintain the product roadmap to keep release deadlines.

About the requirements

● 5+ years of work experience as a product designer.

● Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

● Excellent eye for aesthetic design and customer appeal.

● Excellent attention to detail.

● Meticulous and diligent.

● Strong knowledge of the industry and market trends.

● Bachelor's degree.

● Strong knowledge of computer assisted design (CAD).

● Effective wireframing and prototyping, conducting research, and testing product features

are a plus.

● Tools: Figma, Sketch, or Adobe Creative Suite.
